intro: Uragoga lundiana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a rosette of leaves with a central cluster of flowers. Its flowers are usually brightly colored, ranging from purple to pink, and are pollinated by insects. Uragoga lundiana is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
